Bayang-bayang Krisis Kian Nyata, Jokowi Harus Kerja Keras!
07 Nov 2019, 09:05 by Sylke Febrina Laucereno


Foto: Agung Pambudhy

Jakarta - Peneliti INDEF Abdul Manap Pulungan menjelaskan realisasi pertumbuhan ekonomi kuartal III 2019 yang kian melambat dibanding kuartal sebelumnya menjebak Indonesia pada pertumbuhan sekitar 5%. "Simpul krisis makin dekat dan menjadi tantangan berat untuk Kabinet Indonesia Maju untuk mengakselerasi perekonomian," kata Abdul dalam konferensi pers di Jakarta, Kamis (7/11/2019).Dia mengungkapkan saat ini ada beberapa sumber gejolak ekonomi global seperti perdagangan, energi, perlambatan ekonomi negara maju dan utang, risiko perkembangan politik AS dan risiko dari sektor keuangan. Abdul mengungkapkan perang dagang yang terjadi antara AS dan China membuat prospek ekonomi global mengalami perlambatan. Tahun lalu ada defisit US$ 419 miliar terhadap China pada 2019 periode Januari-Agustus defisit sudah mencapai US$ 231 miliar. Kedua negara ini menguasai sekitar 35% PDB di dunia. Perlambatan ekonomi China juga terus menurun ini akan mempengaruhi ekonomi global karena porsi PDB China mencapai 19% dari PDB dunia. Direktur INDEF Eko Listiyanto mengungkapkan pertumbuhan ekonomi Indonesia semakin melambat hal ini menandakan Indonesia sedang menghadapi masa sulit, baik karena tekanan ekonomi global maupun kurangnya tenaga untuk mendongkrak perekonomian domestik. "Banyak taktik untuk memperbaiki situasi ekonomi yang sedang sulit ini telah disampaikan ke publik, namun hasilnya belum juga bisa dipetik," imbuh dia. Menurut dia, jika dibandingkan dengan capaian kuartal III 2018 pada kuartal III 2019 ini laju investasi dan ekspor kian tertekan sementara konsumsi rumah tangga meskipun masih bisa dipertahankan namun rentan berbagai kenaikan harga seperti tarif jalan tol dan iuran BPJS kesehatan."Secara keseluruhan ini merupakan gambaran risiko resesi ekonomi yang harus segera diantisipasi," ujarnya.Simak Video "Sandi: Pemerintah Terjebak Dalam Pertumbuhan Ekonomi 5%"[Gambas:Video 20detik](kil/eds)

The Shadow of Crisis Is Real, Jokowi Must Work Hard!
Nov 7 2019, 09:05 by Sylke Febrina Laucereno


Photo: Agung Pambudhy

Jakarta - INDEF researcher Abdul Manap Pulungan explained the realization of economic growth in the third quarter of 2019 which is increasingly slowing down compared to the previous quarter trapping Indonesia at around 5% growth. "The knot of the crisis is getting closer and is a formidable challenge for the Advanced Indonesian Cabinet to accelerate the economy," Abdul said in a press conference in Jakarta on Thursday (11/07/2019). He revealed that currently there are several sources of global economic turmoil such as trade, energy, slowdown in developed economies and debt, risks to US political development and risks from the financial sector. Abdul revealed the trade war that occurred between the US and China made the global economic prospect slow down. Last year there was a deficit of US $ 419 billion against China in 2019 for the January-August period the deficit had reached US $ 231 billion. Both of these countries control about 35% of GDP in the world. China's economic slowdown also continues to decline this will affect the global economy because the portion of China's GDP reaches 19% of world GDP. INDEF Director Eko Listiyanto revealed Indonesia's economic growth was slowing further, indicating that Indonesia was facing a difficult time, both due to global economic pressure and the lack of manpower to boost the domestic economy. "Many tactics to improve the current difficult economic situation have been conveyed to the public, but the results have yet to be learned," he added. According to him, when compared to the achievements of the third quarter of 2018 in the third quarter of 2019, the pace of investment and exports was increasingly depressed while household consumption, although still manageable, was still vulnerable to various price increases such as toll road tariffs and health BPJS contributions. "Overall this is a risk picture economic recession that must be anticipated immediately, "he said.
